rComments: One of the sweetest professors I have come across to date. She cares a lot about students understanding material before she moves on. Do not hesitate to ask her to slow down because she will in a heartbeat. She clearly knows her stuff and will be more clear, you only need ask. Her assignments are not impossible and has a sweet sense of humor.
She is a nice teacher, the subject is difficult. I don't think that she is such a bad teacher... she can be a hard to understand, but her way of teaching is pretty good.

If you can take a class with Donka, do it. She is funny and I personally loved her teaching style. She is willing to answer questions and goes through the material at good speed. She loves it when students engage and ask questions; however, if you ask something she has already covered, she won't waste her time. She expects you to pay attention.

As a second langauge learner myself I want to be sympathetic to her, but i'm not. I feel that she may be qualifies to teach language classes but not linguistics. Her referents are fuzzy and her sentences are poorly phrased. I understand the material rather well, but have trouble talking in class because I can't figure out what here questions mean.

The only nice thing I can say about her is that she can be funny at times. She is pretty unclear about the material when teaching it in class.  The TA's don't help much either for their examples in section are just as complicated as her's in lecture. The grading can be unfair and tedious, but overall an A is not out-of-reach.

I love linguistics, but this class was pretty painful.  She was very repetitive.  I was completely shocked when I failed (50/100) my midterm, but she raised my grade a lot.  I ended up with a B, but I think it should have been higher considering the fact that I totally get it!

Donka is a really great teacher who had a real passion for the subject of Structure of French. Her class was easy as long as you came to lectures and paid attention, there were weekly hws and a take home midterm and final. She covers many different, interesting topics if you are into French. She managed to cram a ton of material into the 10 weeks!

Donka is great. She's very kind and pleasant and sweet(and her accent is not at all hard to understand - I quite like it).  Her class is neither too hard nor too easy(I'm referring to Structure of French), and homework is generally not too difficult, as long as you attended class.

I couldn't even understand her speaking because of her accent, so it goes without saying that she is unclear. Even in moments of slight comprehension, she is confusing anyway. Dont know if class is offered with other profs, but opt for those if so.

Donka is really annoying.  I and everyone else got tired of her class and just waited for it to end.  She doesn't explain things well, however, her homework and tests are amazing!!!  I got an A and I do love her for that.  So eh, take her class, why not...
My first linguistics class ever.  Donka is funny and has a way of connecting with her students.  She goes the extra mile to learn and remember her students names, which is not trivial!
Ummm, Donka was amazingly confusing. A nice lady, but I didn't have a single moment of clarity while listening to her try to explain things.
Donka Farkas rocks my socks! she is hilarious, wonderful, and that accent! oh my, I want to take another class from her, she is HILARIOUS AND WONDERFUL!
